title: Girl, 13, ‘beat sister to death then took baby from her womb for child snatcher’
text:
Catia Rabelo was taken into custody following the death of Fabiana Santana and her son Gustavo (Picture: FocusOn News)

A teenager allegedly murdered her older sister then plucked her unborn baby from her womb on the orders of a woman who wanted the baby for herself.

Fabiana Santana, 23, was eight months pregnant when she was bludgeoned to death with a metal pole and hacked open by the girl, 13.

Her son, Gustavo, seven, was also murdered when he tried to save her in Porto Velho, Brazil.

It is alleged that the girl was helped by a boy, 15, on the orders of Catia Rabelo.

Fabiana and Gustavo were reported missing after failing to return home from a night out on October 18 with the two suspects.

Fabiana Santana, 23, was eight months pregnant and is believed to have been alive when her baby was plucked out from inside her (Picture: FocusOn News)

Her body was found buried in a shallow grave three days later and Gustavo’s body was discovered floating in a lake less than 100 metres away from his mum’s body.

An autopsy carried out on her body found that it is likely that she was actually still alive when the baby was cut from her womb.

Rabelo went on the run but was arrested last week and is said to have confessed to police.

Police said the motive is believed to have been a desire to trick her boyfriend into believing she had delivered his baby.

When they found the baby, it was being looked after by the 15-year-old boy and his family.

Rabelo went on the run but was arrested last week and is said to have confessed to police (Picture: FocusOn News)

The newborn, which weighed just under 4lbs, was taken into care at Porto Base Old Hospital where he is said to be in good health.

As well the alleged confession by Rabelo, the girl suspect has made allegations against her dead sister and husband.

Police chief, Leisaloma Carvalho said: ‘The girl made a separate claim that she committed the crimes out of revenge because she was sexually abused by her sister’s husband and ill-treated by Fabiana who didn’t believe her stories.’
